titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: There were but 30 comts at 8 a.m. when Knox celebrated. At the later service I celebrated: there were 101 comts. The congregation at Mattins was disappointingly small. I preached on 'The Day of the Lord'.
In the afternoon I went to the Oxford House, accompanied by Bob Bineham, and addressed about 400 working men.
At Evensong, I preached in S. Margaret's again, and after the Benediction we sang the "Dies Irae".
